HTMLVideoElement.summary: The list of supported media formats varies from one browser to the other. You should either provide your video in a single format that all the relevant browsers supports, or provide multiple video sources in enough different formats that all the browsers you need to support are covered.

remarks.para:
-HTML element implementing this interface: video.
-Supported media formats

HTMLVideoElementCancelVideoFrameCallback.summary: The cancelVideoFrameCallback() method of the interface cancels a previously-registered video frame callback.

remarks.para:
-The video element
-
-Perform efficient per-video-frame operations on video with requestVideoFrameCallback() on developer.chrome.com (2023)

HTMLVideoElementDisablePictureInPicture.summary: The disablePictureInPicture property reflects the HTML attribute indicating whether the picture-in-picture feature is disabled for the current element.

remarks.para: This value only represents a request from the website to the user agent. User configuration may change the eventual behaviorâ€”for example, Firefox users can change the media.videocontrols.picture-in-picture.respect-disablePictureInPicture setting to ignore the request to disable PiP.

HTMLVideoElementDisablePictureInPicture.value: A boolean value that is true if the picture-in-picture feature is disabled for this element. This means that the user agent should not suggest that feature to users, or request it automatically.

HTMLVideoElementEnterpictureinpicture.summary: The enterpictureinpicture event is fired when the enters picture-in-picture mode successfully.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

HTMLVideoElementGetVideoPlaybackQuality.summary:
The method
getVideoPlaybackQuality() creates and returns a
object containing metrics including how many
frames have been lost.

remarks.para: The data returned can be used to evaluate the quality of the video stream.

HTMLVideoElementGetVideoPlaybackQuality.returns:
A object providing information about the video
element's current playback quality.

HTMLVideoElementHeight.summary: The height property of the interface returns an integer that reflects the height attribute of the video element, specifying the displayed height of the resource in CSS pixels.

HTMLVideoElementLeavepictureinpicture.summary: The leavepictureinpicture event is fired when the leaves picture-in-picture mode successfully.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable and does not bubble.

HTMLVideoElementPoster.summary: The poster property of the interface is a string that reflects the URL for an image to be shown while no video data is available. If the property does not represent a valid URL, no poster frame will be shown.

remarks.para: It reflects the poster attribute of the video element.

HTMLVideoElementRequestPictureInPicture.summary:
The method
requestPictureInPicture() issues an asynchronous request
to display the video in picture-in-picture mode.

remarks.para:
It's not guaranteed that the video will be put into picture-in-picture. If permission
to enter that mode is granted, the returned will resolve and the
video will receive a event to let it know that it's now in picture-in-picture.

HTMLVideoElementRequestPictureInPicture.returns:
A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that will resolve to a
object that can be used to listen when a user will resize that floating window.

HTMLVideoElementRequestVideoFrameCallbac.summary: The requestVideoFrameCallback() method of the interface registers a callback function that runs when a new video frame is sent to the compositor. This enables developers to perform efficient operations on each video frame.

remarks.para:
-The video element
-
-Perform efficient per-video-frame operations on video with requestVideoFrameCallback() on developer.chrome.com (2023)

HTMLVideoElementRequestVideoFrameCallbac.returns: A number representing a unique callback ID.This can be passed to to cancel the callback registration.

HTMLVideoElementResize.summary: The resize event of the interface fires when one or both of the and properties have just been updated.

remarks.para: This event is not cancelable but may bubble.

HTMLVideoElementVideoHeight.summary:
The interface's read-only videoHeight property indicates the intrinsic height of the video, expressed in CSS pixels.
In simple terms, this is the height of the media in its natural size.
HTMLVideoElementVideoHeight.value:
An integer value specifying the intrinsic height of the video in CSS pixels.
If the element's is HTMLMediaElement.HAVE_NOTHING, then the value of this property is 0, because neither video nor poster frame size information is yet available.

HTMLVideoElementVideoWidth.summary:
The interface's read-only videoWidth property indicates the intrinsic width of the video, expressed in CSS pixels.
In simple terms, this is the width of the media in its natural size.

remarks.para: See HTMLVideoElement.videoHeight > About intrinsic width and height for more details.

HTMLVideoElementVideoWidth.value:
An integer value specifying the intrinsic width of the video in CSS pixels.
If the element's is HTMLMediaElement.HAVE_NOTHING, then the value of this property is 0, because neither video nor poster frame size information is yet available.

HTMLVideoElementWidth.summary: The width property of the interface returns an integer that reflects the width attribute of the video element, specifying the displayed width of the resource in CSS pixels.
